definition: to collaborate/to join forces/to effect a junction
can/to be possible/to be able to/will/to be likely to/to be sure to/to assemble/to meet/to gather/to see/union/group/association/CL:個|个[ge4]/a moment (Taiwan pr. for this sense is [hui3])

sentences.english: At long last all our forces were reunited.
sentences.chinese: 我們所有的部隊終於會師了。

sentences.english: The two met at Teano, a little north of Naples.
sentences.chinese: 兩支隊伍在那不勒斯稍北的泰阿諾會師。

sentences.english: They finally succeeded in joining the two forces.
sentences.chinese: 他們最終成功地使兩支軍隊會師了。

sentences.english: Our advance troops married up with partisans pressing down from the hills.
sentences.chinese: 我們先遣部隊跟山上下來的游擊隊員們會師了。

sentences.english: Beyond that bridge was the linkup point with units from the 29th Division coming from Omaha.
sentences.chinese: 此橋過去就是與奧馬哈登陸之第29師會師地。
